A small, reasonably priced
sword. Handles well, but
not especially powerful.

A long sword with a steel
blade. Recommended for
serious combat.

A sword from the far east.
Its exquisite curved blade
is extremely sharp.

A sword forged from a unique
alloy. Its blue blade has a
keen cutting edge.

A golden sword, imbued with
divine fire. It shimmers
with destructive heat.

The strongest sword of all.
Its blade glows, suffused
with the magic of Cleria.

A hard wooden shield with
metal fittings. Not bad, but
also not particularly good.

A small metal shield. Strong
and handles well, but only
of real use to beginners.

A large shield that covers
half the body. Difficult to
handle, but defends well.

A shield made of the finest
iron. Very sturdy, offering
excellent defense.

A golden shield of immense
strength. Offers protection
against any physical attack.

A shield of Cleria. Offers
top-rate defense, along with
the Goddesses' blessings.

Finely woven chain mail.
Deflects sword strikes, but
is weak to heavy blows.

A breastplate crafted from
steel, offering good defense
and maneuverability.

Armor of hammered steel.
Heavy, but fully covers the
body, offering high defense.

Armor made from a unique
metal. Its reflective resin
deflects most attacks.

Golden armor, boasting
superb defense. Weaker
blows can't even scratch it.

Cleria armor; stronger than
any other. Worn by he who is
chosen by the Goddesses.

Magic of Tovah, priest
of Strength. Transforms
willpower into fire.

Magic of Dabbie, priest of
Light. Illuminates all that
is hidden.

Magic of Hadal, priest of
Earth. Transports the user
to select towns or villages.

Magic of Mesa, priest
of Time. Freezes the
flow of time itself.

Magic of Gemma, priest of
Knowledge. Makes Adol a Roo,
letting him talk to demons.

Magic of Fact, priest of
Spirit. Creates a barrier
that none can penetrate.

A feather cloak worn by
spirits of legend. Brings
healing power to its wearer.

A hawk idol with piercing
blue eyes. Focuses the
power of fire on its target.

A falcon idol with piercing
red eyes. Focuses fire magic
with greater accuracy.

A shiny ring made of Cleria,
imbued with the power of
the Goddesses' protection.

Has a soft green hue. When
worn, it calms the soul and
soothes away one's troubles.

A ring worn by a Goddess.
Imbued with the power to
purify evil.

One of the six Books of Ys.
Written by Hadal, the Priest
of Earth.

One of the six Books of Ys.
Written by Tovah, the Priest
of Strength.

One of the six Books of Ys.
Written by Dabbie, the
Priest of Light.

One of the six Books of Ys.
Written by Mesa, the
Priest of Time.

One of the six Books of Ys.
Written by Gemma, the
Priest of Knowledge.

One of the six Books of Ys.
Written by Fact, the Priest
of Spirit.

A stone tablet describing
the Books of Ys and the
Sanctuary of Toal.

A cane made from fine, old
wood. In Ys, it served as
proof of a great leader.

A mineral with a dull sheen.
Worthless now, but can be
refined to top-tier steel.

Frozen ice crystals. If used
in a moist atmosphere, the
water will solidify.

A key of dull brass.
It'll open most of the
doors in the Shrine.

A rusted iron key. Opens
the Water Control Room
beneath the Shrine.

Magic earrings with the
power to amplify even the
faintest of sounds.

A mysterious shell given to
Adol by Hadat. Allows for
long-distance communication.

A pass to the north part of
the Shrine. If shown to the
guard, he'll open the gate.

Blue-jeweled necklace. Use
at the Goddess statue to
reach the Central Shrine.

Red-jeweled necklace. Use
at the Goddesses' statues to
enter the Shrine's Core.

Reah's harmonica. Its
clear timbre has the
power to dispel evil.

An ominous looking bell
shaped like a skull. Its
evil sound summons demons.

When read before the
Goddesses' statues, their
guidance will be granted.

A beautifully-decorated
mirror with the power
to dissolve foul illusions.

A jet black gemstone of
profound magic, housing an
unnatural flame at its core.

A sacred vessel that
purifies water, giving it
the ability to dispel evil.

A bust in the form of a
holy woman from ancient
times. Provides healing.

An old Mattock. Can break
through fragile walls and
clear away rubble.

A letter to Dr. Flair, from
Banoa of Lance Village.

A cure for Lilia's sickness,
made from Celceta Flower
and Roda Fruit.

Shoes made with stone soles.
Grants their wearer perfect
stability on icy slopes.

A blessed leaf from the Roda
Tree. Has the ability to
filter out poisonous gas.

A mysterious potion which
can miraculously revive the
dead. Only one vial exists.

A mysterious, magical wing.
Allows its user to return to
previously-visited locales.

A medicine found all
over Ys. Has the power
to heal minor wounds.

A succulent red apple.
Satisfies hunger and
restores health.

A blessed fruit from the
Roda Tree. One bite will
restore all MP.

Pink, wild and grows
almost anywhere. Its scent
soothes a troubled mind.

Has translucent blue petals
and blooms in areas with
no sunlight. Revitalizing.

A red berry, as shiny as a
jewel. Its bitter flavor and
fresh scent cure fatigue.

Smoked meat of the finest
quality. Its delicious
flavor restores strength.

Tasty lean meat. If roasted
with salt and eaten, it can
do a body good!

Baked to a light brown
color. A bite of this will
restore strength instantly.

A pie made from fresh
cruberries. A delicacy with
a sweet, yet tart flavor.

A vial filled with a murky
blue liquid. Gives insight
on defeated enemies.

I will see to it that your spells
cause us no further inconvenience!

A girl Adol rescued from the
underground labyrinth of the
shrine during his previous
adventure. Lost her memory,
but was taken in by Jeba of
Zepik Village. Promised Adol
they'd meet again.

A girl Adol rescued from the
underground labyrinth of the
shrine during his previous
adventure. She was revealed
to be one of the Goddesses
of Ys, along with her sister
Reah. Offers Adol guidance.

A troubadour Adol met during
his previous adventure. Lost
her harmonica, but Adol
returned it. The two were
reunited in Rado's Annex,
where she'd been imprisoned
for purposes unknown.

A troubadour Adol met during
his previous adventure. Once
Adol reached the land of Ys,
he learned that she was
actually one of the twin
Goddesses. Offered Adol
guidance on his journey.

The leader of a band of
honorable thieves, met by
Adol during his previous
adventure. Feared by the
villagers, but beloved by
his men. Descended from one
of the Priests of Ys: Tovah.

A sleepwalking poet Adol met
on his previous adventure.
Adol later met him again in
Darm Tower, and received a
mystical charm from him.
Luta is descended from one
of the Priests of Ys: Gemma.

Goban's mother, and Sara's
aunt. Met by Adol on his
previous adventure. Lives in
Zepik Village, and is a very
kindly soul. Descended from
one of the Priests of Ys:
Tovah.

A fortuneteller Adol met
on his previous adventure.
Recognized him immediately
as the legendary brave soul
destined to save the land.
Guided Adol on his way, but
paid the ultimate price.

One of Goban's men, with a
penchant for breaking walls.
Rescued Adol from prison on
his previous adventure, as
well as Luta Gemma. Strong,
kindly and loyal, he and
Adol quickly became friends.

A descendant of one of the
six Priests of Ys: Fact. Was
corrupted by evil, intending
to take over the world by
utilizing the Books of Ys.
Adol faced off against him,
and thwarted his plans.

A Priest from the ancient
kingdom of Ys. Supported
the twin Goddesses, and was
the governing priest of
Power. Both Goban and Jeba
are descendants.

A Priest from the ancient
kingdom of Ys. Supported
the twin Goddesses, and was
the governing priest of
Light. It is unknown if
there are any descendants.

A Priest from the ancient
kingdom of Ys. Supported
the twin Goddesses, and was
the governing priest of
Earth. It is unknown if
there are any descendants.

A Priest from the ancient
kingdom of Ys. Supported
the twin Goddesses, and was
the governing priest of
Time. It is unknown if
there are any descendants.

A Priest from the ancient
kingdom of Ys. Supported
the twin Goddesses, and was
the governing priest of
Wisdom. Luta is a current
descendant of this lineage.

A Priest from the ancient
kingdom of Ys. Supported
the twin Goddesses, and was
the governing priest of
Spirit. Dark Fact was a
descendant of this lineage.

A young girl from Lance.
Nursed Adol back to health
after his arrival in Ys.
A kind, gentle girl beloved
by young and old alike
within the village. Lives
with her mother, Banoa.

An old woman from Lance.
Helped take care of Adol
after his arrival in Ys, and
kindly worried over him even
after he recovered. Lives
with her daughter, Lilia.

A young man who guards the
entrance to the abandoned
Rasteenie Mine, where demons
have been spotted of late.
Dependable and well-liked
amongst the villagers.

A young man from Lance.
Brother of Dr. Flair Rall,
he studies medicine under
him as his apprentice.
When Dr. Flair was away, he
did his best to care for
Adol. Obsessively devoted.

A doctor from Lance. A very
talented, popular man. After
being rescued from a cave-
in, he learned of Lilia's
illness by letter, and asked
Adol to gather the ingredi-
ents needed for a cure.

A quick-witted, 'Hello,
Nurse!' nurse from Lance.
Works in Dr. Flair's clinic.
Sought after by many men,
but is presently single.
Been a nurse for 4 years,
and is now 21 years old.

The elder of Lance. When he
saw the Books of Ys, he
advised Adol to return them
to the Sanctuary of Toal.
Also said he witnessed two
girls resembling the twin
Goddesses. Loves sunbathing.

Elder Cornell's wife. Calmly
settled in her ways, she
seems at peace with the
world. Sensitive and kind,
never forgetting to treat
the villagers with respect.
Her hobby is knitting.

An armorer from Lance. Been
busy since the demon revival
6 months ago. Though he has
assistants, he can't get the
materials he needs to forge
armor anymore. Renowned for
his heavy drinking.

An item trader from Lance.
Values his work more than
the money he makes from it.
Loves chatting with his
customers more than anything
else. His one vial of Elixir
is the pride of his shop.

A young man from Lance who
values calm and solitude
above all else. Usually
immersed in his thoughts,
but has lately been troubled
by unexplained noises.
Greatly enjoys poetry.

An old man with great know-
ledge of magic and the
legends of Ys. Spends his
days staring at the Goddess
statues, which causes the
villagers to joke about
him. Remains a bachelor.

A Lance villager skilled in
armorcrafting. Due to the
demons, however, he can't
get the Iron Ore he needs,
which has depressed him
greatly. Has a wife, Tess,
and a son, Tran.

Lazlo's wife, and Tran's
mother. Hopelessly devoted
to her family, and greatly
concerned by Lazlo's recent
bouts of depression. Wishes
he could get the Iron Ore
he needs to resume working.

Son of Lazlo and Tess.
Respects his hard-working
father a great deal, and
cannot bear to see him so
troubled. His ambition is
to follow in his daddy's
footsteps as a smithy.

Lance's gate guard, sworn to
protect the village from
demons at all costs. Dozes
off on hot days, but seems
to have been successful thus
far nonetheless. Lives with
his mother, Lucille.

A miner from Lance. Sheila's
husband, and father to Kris
and Ceres. Wishes he could
return to work at the mine,
but respects his family's
wishes too much to put
himself in danger like that.

Bohtz's wife, and mother to
Kris and Ceres. Worries
about her husband due to the
demons in the mine. Normally
a sweet, motherly type, but
can be scarier than any
demon when enraged.

The elder of two twins from
Lance, and the joker of the
pair. Always together with
her sister, Ceres. She isn't
scared of the demons at all,
but is absolutely terrified
when her mother gets mad.

The younger of two twins
from Lance. Always together
with her sister, Kris. Isn't
scared of the demons at all,
but is absolutely terrified
when her mother gets mad.
Idolizes her big sis.

A man from Lance Village.
Lives with his mother, Beth,
and his wife, Marina. He's a
fun-loving soul, but all the
depressing rumors of late
have begun getting him down.

A housewife from Lance.
Worries about the safety of
the village, but is even
more concerned by the
constant rise in prices
for basic commodities due
to a dwindling supply.

An old woman from Lance.
Lives with her son, Brody,
and Marina, his wife. Acts
like she's farsighted, but
may be faking it for atten-
tion. Wants grandchildren,
but refuses to tell anyone.

An old woman from Lance
Village. Works as a house-
keeper for Astal and Leggs.
Since those two are so
often out at the Ruins of
Moondoria, she often gets
the house all to herself.

A man living in Lance who's
been hearing strange noises
from underground ever since
the demons first appeared.
He tries to ignore them, but
can't help listening when-
ever they start up again.

An old man from Lance
Village. Settled in the
area long ago, and laments
the recent changes in the
land. An old friend of
Leggs', and an overall
compassionate man.

An outwardly AND inwardly
calm housewife; well-matched
with her kindly husband, the
one and only Jade. Like any
stereotypical wife, her
hobbies include cookery and
idle gossip.

Larsen's mother, and a
resident of Lance Village.
Possesses some psychic
powers, and has recently
been made aware of an evil
presence at Gila's House.

A gossipy girl from Lance
who loves learning secrets,
but loves telling them even
more-- and since people know
that, they're usually not
eager to share any with her.
Looks great with a ponytail.

A boy from Lance who hates
being treated like a kid.
Talks like a ruffian, but
is actually a very kind,
compassionate little man.
Always plays together with
Tita, and adores Lilia.

A girl from Lance who gets
jealous of pretty much
everything. Tends to yammer
a bit, and follows Colt
everywhere, playing games
around the village. As with
Colt, she also adores Lilia.

A young girl from Lance, and
a friend of Lilia's. Wonders
if there's any future for
Adol and Lilia as a couple.
A cheerful, lively soul, who
loves to get herself mixed
up in the affairs of others.

Younger sister to Theo, the
pikkard-keeper. Has a rather
charming lisp. At Theo's
behest, she tends to the
needs of the penned pikkards
in Lance. Loves writing
lyrics and naming pikkards.

A pikkard-keeper who's been
raising his livestock in the
village since the advent of
the monsters. Sometimes lets
his sister, Lucy, tend them,
but has begun to question
the wisdom of that decision.

A young man from Lance who
always thinks, but never
acts. He's generally thought
of as being full of hot air,
and most people have learned
to ignore his ramblings.

A woman from Lance who's
recently been tormented by
ominous howling sounds from
below the ground every
single night. They keep
her awake, and as a result,
she's constantly exhausted.

A man from the Colony of
Lava. Minds the drawbridge
at the north end of the
village, but it seems to be
out of order right now, so
no one is able to cross.
Has a son named Tarf.

A boy from the Colony of
Lava. Ruba's son. Recently
abducted by demons and
imprisoned in a cave. Became
rather attached to Adol
after being rescued by him.
Thinks of Adol as a big bro.

A man from the Colony of
Lava. Has a stern tempera-
ment, and greets Adol with
harsh words on their first
encounter. Lives with his
wife, Natalie.

A woman from the Colony of
Lava. Lives with her cranky
husband and one black cat.
In contrast to her husband's
nervousness, Natalie is a
rather calm, cool woman. The
cat's name is Van Treine.

A man from the Colony of
Lava. Lives a mostly care-
free existence, worrying
more about the disappearance
of the Roos than the demons
outside the village. Married
to Rafa.

A woman from the Colony of
Lava. Her husband Noit's
devil-may-care attitude
worries her more than the
demons outside the village.
Has a personality very simi-
lar to that of her husband.

An old man from the Colony
of Lava. Despite his age,
he's actually very healthy.
Honest and forthright, which
means he's awful at keeping
secrets. His granddaughter's
influence keeps him young.

Rex's granddaughter, from
the Colony of Lava. Been un-
able to play with her friend
Tarf lately, so she's gotten
a bit bored. With no female
friends to play with, too,
she's a bit of a tomboy.

An old man from the Colony
of Lava. Used to work as
the drawbridge guard, but
has entrusted that duty to a
new generation now. A kind
man, respected by all the
villagers.

A girl from the Colony of
Lava. A bit shy, and makes a
cold first impression. Comes
across as rude, but is actu-
ally a very kind person who
loves children.

A woman from the Colony of
Lava. Speaks curtly, but is
very kind at heart. Friends
with Rafa, and loves to dish
out secrets with her about
her husband, Carson. Rafa
generally returns the favor.

A man from the Colony of
Lava. Tends the south-side
drawbridge. Sometimes visits
the Ice Ridge to cool off,
but always feels nervous
doing so. Married to Meryl
(an older woman-- egads!).

Kasim's son, from the Colony
of Lava. Mischievous and
full of energy. Hopes to set
off on an adventure of his
own one day. Good friends
with Tarf, and often talks
of his grand plans with him.

A man from the Colony of
Lava. Ischt's father, and
he constantly worries about
his son. Often seems overly
strict, especially to out-
siders, but he's really just
a concerned parent.

A gentle soul from the Colony
of Lava with long, glossy black
hair. Quiet and polite, she is
beloved by children. She gets
on very well with her cousin,
Elle, even though they are
complete opposites.

An old woman from the Colony
of Lava. Often seems a bit
clueless and loopy, but not
due to her age-- apparently,
she's always been like that!
Can't see or hear well, but
can gossip with the best.

A young man from the Colony
of Lava. Commonly thought to
be a bit wishy-washy, but is
actually a logical, level-
headed individual. Hasn't a
mean bone in his body-- he's
as nice as can be!

It's a frightened Roo! Was
driven into hiding by the
demons, and now fears them.
As such, he refuses to leave
the nest, only occasionally
peeking his head out to
reaffirm his safety.

It's a gentlemanly Roo!
Loves to chat, and loves to
lecture other Roos on the
art of gentlemanliness.
Has a brother named Tallyroo
who constantly talks about
him behind his back.

It's a gossipy Roo! Tells
anyone and everyone who'll
listen all about his brother
Brooce, claiming 'it's a
secret' every time. Tallyroo
is the youngest of these
adorable little creatures.

It's a hospitable Roo! Can
go a bit overboard on the
niceties, but in general,
he's very polite and
courteous, offering passers-
by a spot to rest beside a
tree in the Roos' Nest.

It's an optimistic Roo! One
who won't let the fact that
the demons drove the Roos
from their habitat get him
down. Considers laughter
the best medicine, and loves
living in the Roos' Nest.

It's a curious Roo! Gentle
and kindly, but also a bit
sneaky. Loves to escape the
nest and explore, and saw
a demon walking deep into
the Moat of Burnedbless with
a human child the other day.

It's a cutesy Roo! When Adol
introduced himself after
turning into a Roo, she
dubbed him 'Ado-roo.' Speaks
softly, but carries a big...
friendly disposition. Stick.
Or something.

It's a sleeping Roo! Quite
literally, Droozy is always
asleep. No one's ever seen
him awake. The only reason
anyone knows he's alive is
because of his snoring. What
might he be dreaming of?

A friendly demon who can
communicate with humans.
Was imprisoned with Tarf in
the dungeon at Burnedbless.
Appears to be fighting on
the humans' side, so he's
constantly targeted.

A young gate guard from
Ramia. A woman in his dreams
told him to lend Adol assis-
tance, so he offers advice
and aid from the moment Adol
sets foot in Ramia.

An old man from Ramia who
yearns for the peaceful days
of old, and pities the young
generation who have to grow
up alongside demons. Lives
with his grandson, Gorto,
and a white cat, Sardinette.

A wise and popular man from
Ramia, relied upon by many
for his knowledge and expe-
rience. Is presently worried
for his son, who entered
Solomon Shrine alone to
rescue his fiancee.

Hadat's son. Brave and
devoted, he forced his way
into Solomon Shrine alone
to rescue his fiancee from
the demons. Was turned to
stone, but Adol broke the
curse. Gave Adol his sword.

A girl from Ramia who was
abducted by the demons and
sent to the bell tower to be
sacrificed. Was living with
her mother, Karen, and was
scheduled to marry Sada in
the very near future.

Maria's mother. Weeps when
she hears the sacrificial
bell toll, as she knows the
horror it signifies. Had
been sewing and tailoring
a wedding dress for Maria's
marriage to Sada.

Old Man Regg. An eccentric
old coot from Ramia who
studies artifacts from the
Shrine of Solomon, and can
speak the language of the
monsters. Has a healing well
in his basement, strangely.

A weapons dealer from Ramia
who looks good-- and knows
it! Her customers seem more
interested in her long,
black hair and revealing
outfits than her weapons.
She, however, loves swords.

A young girl from Ramia, ja?
Maria's best friend since
they were but wee little
Kindern together. Used to be
positive and full of energy,
but Maria's abduction really
got her feeling schlecht.

A man from Ramia who's been
charged with keeping people
out of Burnedbless, but is
usually at the village en-
trance tending to the goats.
Has become concerned over
Regg's deepening depression.

A man from Ramia Village.
Has a young daughter named
Tanya and a wife named
Paulie, who is 15 years his
junior. Together, they con-
stantly worry about when
the demons may strike next.

Blitz's wife, and Tanya's
mother. Has been ill at ease
since the demons first began
attacking. Sympathizes
deeply with Karen, whose
daughter was taken-- a fate
Paulie fears for Tanya.

A girl from Ramia Village.
Blitz and Paulie's only
daughter. Has grown too
frightened to leave her home
since witnessing demons
attack the village.

A young man from Ramia who
works the opposite shift of
Gorto, guarding the village
entrance from demons. Was
once a cheerful and sociable
youth, but the demon attacks
have driven him batty.

A boy from Ramia who bore
witness to Maria's abduction
and now seeks to grow strong
in order to protect his own
family. Totally fearless,
but would never go against
his parents' wishes for him.

A young man from Ramia.
Tends the graves of those
who lost their lives to
the demons. A sensitive soul
who does what he feels he
must, but hates every moment
of it on principle alone.

An old woman from Ramia
Village. Obsessively
concerns herself over
Karen, who's shut herself
up in her house after the
demons took Maria.

A woman living in Ramia
Village. Sociable almost to
a fault, accepting strangers
with open arms. A courageous
woman who never complains,
no matter the hardship.
Frau and Faye's mother.

A girl living in Ramia
Village. Wanders frantically
through the village looking
for her father, Kyle, who
was taken by the demons.
Seems almost like a confused
puppy that lost its master.

A man from Ramia Village who
was taken by the demons. He
escaped from confinement
before becoming a sacrifice,
and hid in the Subterranean
Canal. Has a young daughter
back in Ramia named Rimera.

A man from Ramia Village,
who was taken by demons. Was
rescued by Keith, and is now
hiding in the Subterranean
Canal. Keith, a friendly
demon, oddly reminds him of
his dead friend from Ramia.

A man from Ramia Village,
who was taken by demons. Was
rescued by Keith, and thus
escaped the sacrificial
ceremony. Unable to leave
the Shrine, he stays hidden
in the Subterranean Canal.

A corpse possessed by the
spirits of demons killed on
the battlefield. Its rotting
body makes it slow to attack
but its claws and fangs
conceal a deadly poison.

A goblin subspecies which
revels in destruction and
slaughter. Always on the
hunt for new spoils. Not
very intelligent, but sur-
prisingly cunning.

Once a stone gargoyle, but
was possessed by evil power
and transformed into a
demon. Carries no weapons,
but its fists alone should
not be underestimated.

A demon from the Sanctuary
of Toal. Coils its body and
swiftly strikes its prey.
Its four tentacles grip the
victim as it stabs with the
poisoned barb in its tail.

Wanders underground, as it
despises daylight. Its pale
form is coated with thick
leather skin. Seeks out all
who are lost in the Ruins,
attacking them mercilessly.

A type of slime formed from
cohesive fluids that enable
it to bend its elastic body,
giving it general resistance
to physical attacks. Highly
flammable, however.

A type of lichen that's
absorbed evil will from the
atmosphere, transforming it
into a demon. Fiercely
territorial, it suffocates
those who breach its lair.

A carnivorous plant that
intoxicates its prey with
gassy discharge, then eats
it whole while it's para-
lyzed. The victim is gradu-
ally digested overnight.

A generally sluggish demon
that flies into a frenzy
once its prey has been
spotted. Possesses surpri-
sing speed and strength.
Do not underestimate.

A demon produced when mold
and lichen grow over a
corpse. Moves by dragging
its serpentine body across
the ground, and crushes
its prey like a constrictor.

A six-taloned demon that
crawls around like a spider.
Much heavier than a human
being. Crushes its prey
and devours it whole.
Inhabits Rasteenie Mine.

Bloodstained armor adorns
this decapitated cretin, who
uses its own head as a
shield. No body can be found
inside its armor-- only a
miasmic, malicious will.

A well-defended demon able
to hack apart its prey with
its sharp scythes. However,
as an ice elemental, it is
predictably weak against
fireballs.

A demon descended from a
proud tribe, now serving
the demons as a soldier.
Its mind has regressed to
the level of a beast, but
its combat skill remains.

Once a holy race that soared
majestically in the sky, its
many misdeeds caused its
wings to atrophy, and it was
banished from the holy
sanctuary.

A turtle-like demon from the
Ice Ridge of Noltia. Despite
its appearance, it attacks
with tremendous speed. It
may hobble and wobble, but
it does so VERY QUICKLY.

A demon from the Ice Ridge
of Noltia. A cyclops with
muscles like armor. Unin-
telligent, but extremely
powerful. Relies on brute
strength alone.

Once a gentle, domesticated
race, the demonic influence
transformed these ram-horned
creatures into carnivorous
savages with bloodshot eyes.
Found in the Ice Ridge.

A being said to have evolved
from ancient fire lizards.
Though no longer able to
control fire, it still gra-
vitates toward high-heat
environments.

A demon resembling an ape,
with a curved back, long
arms and clawed fingers.
Upon catching sight of an
enemy, it rushes into battle
at full speed.

A two-tailed scorpion with a
peculiar leg structure that
allows for quick, silent
movement. One strike from
its poisoned barbs will kill
its prey in short order.

A horned demon from Burned-
bless. Has a human body with
the head of a bull. Strikes
at foes with a large axe,
but will also happily gore
its victims with its horns.

Once a harmless fire sprite,
the demonic influence trans-
formed this creature into a
malicious beast. As it is
already wreathed in flame,
Fire magic does not hurt it.

A sluggish demon from the
Moat of Burnedbless. Its
back is protected by a
carapace, which provides
excellent defense with its
firmness and flexibility.

A living fossil from the age
of the dinosaurs. Quick to
anger, and attacks both with
the force of its weight, and
with the two long spikes
that protrude from its back.

A demon from the fiery Moat
of Burnedbless. Its body is
made up of a lump of fused
lava, mercilessly burning
all it touches. Fire magic
has no effect on it.

A bio-luminescent ogre with
a taste for flesh. Attacks
its prey without mercy,
brutally flaying them with
its spear. Found in the
Shrine's entrance areas.

A demonic monk bearing a
magic wand and cloaked in
dark red robes. A low-rank
mage, but the energy it
fires from its eyes is
quite deadly nonetheless.

A goblin-like creature that
keeps most of its body
shielded while striking foes
with a spear. Often uses its
horns to throw its prey into
the air for easier hits.

A demon found in the north-
east part of the Shrine.
Floats about, wielding a
scythe like the Grim Reaper.
One swing can easily split
a man in twain.

A statue-like demon that
stays perfectly still to
fool its prey, then strikes
when they least expect it.
Drains the life energy of
its prey with its eyes.

Strongest of the humanoid
demons. Adorned in golden
armor that's harder than
diamonds. Only the mighti-
est of strikes can even come
close to penetrating it.

A demon renowned for its one
red eye. Can roll itself up
into its shell for protec-
tion, and its exoskeleton
bends and gives readily,
allowing for quick movement.

A demon with the lower body
of a horse, but a buffalo's
horns on its head. Carries a
large trident which it
wields with great precision,
impaling all who oppose it.

A demon found in the west
section of Solomon Shrine.
Has thick skin and unnatural
strength. Wields a two-
handed halberd to eliminate
its opposition.

A high-ranking goblin with
an armor-like appearance.
Though its strength and
intelligence are average at
best, it's extremely self-
conscious, angering readily.

A small beast from the canal
possessing the strength of a
giant and the agility of an
eagle. Kills by attaching
its legs to the target's
head, and suffocating it.

Originally a member of the
mightiest tribe of dragons.
Its wings have devolved into
a useless state, but its
fiery breath remains intact.
Found in the Central Shrine.

Found in the Central Shrine.
The horns which grow from
its head are proof of its
noble descent from dragons.
Can cleave a man in twain
with its mighty tail.

Found in the Central Shrine.
The horns which grow from
its head are proof of its
noble descent from dragons.
Can cleave a man in twain
with its mighty tail.

Found in the Central Shrine.
A tough, four-armed monster
with bright blue skin. Its
crimson claws can cut down
any intruder, leaving not a
moment to counterattack.

A Bearot elite. Demands to
be referred to by its given
title, 'Master,' and brings
down its wrath upon any
who dare refuse this simple
request.

Looks like a brutish human,
but with tough skin. Wields
a hatchet-like blade. The
expression on its alligator-
like face betrays its lust
for slaughter.

A lizardman well-versed in
the lore of demons after 100
years of study. Wears a
bluish robe and carries a
staff, from which it fires
painful blasts of energy.

A heavily-armored warrior
witch who serves as body-
guard to Zava. Uses its
mastery of swordplay to
chop its victims to pieces.
Found in the royal chambers.

A Bearot noble who guards
the gates of Solomon Shrine.
Undefeated in battle. Its
kind has been dubbed the
'Blazing Madmen,' and it
does live up to that name.

Appears as a beautiful young
woman, but is actually a
loyal follower of Zava,
intent upon dealing death.
A favorite of Zava's due to
its unmatched abilities.

A huge demon whose body is
protected from sword strikes
by a hard shell. Fires
energy from its eye to
decimate its victims. Since
physical attacks are inef-
fective, those with no magic
are doomed in its wake.

An ice creature with pre-
cision control over its
chosen elemental. With its
one eye and strong back legs
it can make mighty leaps to
attack from above. When it
strikes the ground, deadly
shards of ice are scattered.

A truly hideous beast with
the appearance of a giant's
severed head. Approaches
its prey slowly, occasion-
ally releasing an oversized
tentacle from its mouth to
block an escape route. Its
thick hide is impenetrable.

Looks like a giant spider,
more or less. With its four
rigid legs, it can only be
damaged from the front.
Launches countless exploding
eggs and balls of energy in
an attempt to toy with its
prey for sheer amusement.

The third most powerful of
all the demons. Commands
countless minions, and has
the appearance of a gorgeous
woman, like her attendants.
When angered, she'll flay
every last bit of flesh from
the bones of her prey.

The puppetmaster with the
Cleria Cloak who commands
the demons. Born of pure
demon heritage, making him
invulnerable to magic. Only
Darm is stronger-- and Darm
is the only man Dalles
answers to.

The source of all magic and
all demons. Once guided the
land of Ys to prosperity,
but later spawned demonkind.
Some call him the devil. His
true form is the Black
Pearl-- an item housing un-
imaginable dark power.
